ROSETTASCRIPTS.SCOREFXNS:
Low res score function used during DockingProtocol ((5))
High res score function used during FastDesign
Basic score function used for filters, for calculating BUNs, and during InterfaceAnalyzer
ROSETTASCRIPTS.RESIDUE_SELECTORS:
Entire chain B is considered designable ((3))
Receptor-specific residue, source of distance constraint for docking Receptor-specific residue, source of distance constraint for docking Receptor-specific residue, source of distance constraint for docking Receptor-specific residue, source of distance constraint for docking
Scaffold-specific residue, source of distance constraint for docking Scaffold-specific residue, source of distance constraint for docking
/Source of distant constraints for C-N termini docking filter/ Receptor-specific residue, source of distance constraint for C-N terminus filter, uses internal numbering for total number of residues present (excludes missing residues) Scaffold-specific residue, source of distance constraint for C-N terminus filter, uses internal numbering as: "receptor-C-term" + 1
Receptor-specific residue, R139 is designable (but optional if removed from "designable"). Note: Arg139 is found in WT PD-1 3rrq and HA10 PD-1 5ius
/// GROUPED SELECTORS ///
Note: OrResidueSelector creates the union of the ResidueSelectors it contains. Combines chain B and residue 139 of chain A and deems them both designable All residues not deemed designable are grouped as "NOT-designable" ((1))
/Source of interface between receptor and scaffold/
This logic selects residues that are either already in direct contact with residues in the other group or that are pointing their c-alpha-c-beta vectors towards the other group.
All residues not at the interface between chain A and chain B (receptor and scaffold) are grouped as "NOT-interface" ((2))
/Source of a "directed" interface between receptor faces (on chain A) and the designable residue selection of the scaffold (chain B)/ Note: OrResidueSelector creates the union of the ResidueSelectors it contains. Combines chain A receptor faces. Subset of designable residues at the interface of the receptor faces on chain A. Selects residues pointing c-a-c-b vectors to the other group. Note: AndResidueSelector creates the intersection of the ResidueSelectors it contains. Used to determine and maximize the # of designable residues AT the interface ((6))
/Source of a "groove" interface between the receptor groove (selective residues on chain A binding groove) and the designable residue selection of the scaffold (chain B)/
Note: AndResidueSelector creates the intersection of the ResidueSelectors it contains. Used to determine the # hphobic residues at the groove interface ON the receptor Note: OrResidueSelector cfeates the union. Scaffold designable interface res + hphobic receptor designable res at the groove interface
ROSETTASCRIPTS.TASKOPERATIONS:
'to' is a suffix for all task-ops | repack interface, minimize all atoms
Turns off design (but still allows both repacking and minimization) to all residues not deemed designable as a RLT (Residue Level TaskOperation) ((1))
Turns off design and repacking (only minimizes) to all residues outside the interface of chain A and chain B ((2)) ??? Overrides No-pack_design to???????
A restricted list of AAs (does not include CYS) allowed in design during fast design for the chain B scaffold ((3))
Allows R139 to exclusively mutate to R (WT residue), or G,I,L,A,F,V (hydrophobics) for Arg139 on receptor ((4))
Necessary option to enable reading commandline options Rotamer options applied during FastDesign for increased rotamer sampling of chi1 and chi2 to a standard deviation of 1
ROSETTASCRIPTS.FILTERS:
?????????????? Computes the atom_pair_constraint of the pose, filter only keeps docking designs that lower than the threshold (that satisfy the atom_pair_constraint term during docking) ((5)) ????SHOULD Threshold by SET AT 5? OR AT 15? ?????? Count # of interface residues that are designable, minimum is too high to be a functional filter. Applied to the designable residues on chain B at the interface of the scaffold and receptor ((6)) Sum # of designable groove interface res AND the hphobic receptor res at the interface Threshold is too high to be functional, used to do simple math ((8)) Threshold is too high to be functional, used as a score reporter ((9))
New filter ((8))
New filter created to normalize dG_separated/dSASAx100 and E_total, created using the basic score function ((8))
Used to create a new filter based on dSASA_int, the solvent accessible area burried at the interface in square Angstroms ((10)) ((10)) ???? I think this calculation is used to create a negative value, and then applied to only keep the lowest values -- which would correspond to keeping the highest dSASA??? ((10))
New filter for BUNs based on back bone bonds, allowing a small cutoff of expected BUNs (found in loops, generally) ((11)) New filter for BUNs based on side chain bonds, allowing a small cutoff of expected BUNs (found in loops, generally) ((12)) New filter for bb + sc BUNS (13)
ROSETTASCRIPTS.MOVERS:
Fast design protocol (which cycles bw repack and minimization with an increasing repulsive weight during each of the 4 cycles) that uses the MonomerDesign2019 (to reduce excessive ALA designs) instead of the rosettacon2018 relax script, and is applied to the designable and non-designable regions of the proteins ((1)), ((2)), ((3)), ((4)) ????? Does it override different task operations???? Fast design protocol (which cycles bw repack and minimization with an increasing repulsive weight during each of the 4 cycles) that uses the MonomerDesign2019 (to reduce excessive ALA designs) instead of the rosettacon2018 relax script, and is applied to the designable and non-designable regions of the proteins ((1)), ((2)), ((3)), ((4)) ????? Does it override different task operations????
???? Do I need to have a RemoveConstraints mover? Is a ClearConstraintMover okay? And do I need to name is here? Or in the Generator????? Flat harmonic function used to equally favor any distance, as long as the constraint is satisfied. Excludes models when at least 1 designable residue (on scaffold) is not near selected receptor residue by some Angstrom: X_0 SD +/-TOL
Flat harmonic function used to equally favor any distance, as long as the constraint is satisfied. Excludes models when at least 1 designable residue (on scaffold) is not near selected receptor residue by some Angstrom: X_0 SD +/-TOL
Flat harmonic function used to equally favor any distanc
Flat harmonic function used to equally favor any distanc
Flat harmonic function used to equally favor any distance, as long as the constraint is satisfied. Excludes models when receptor-C-term and the scaffold-N-term are further than 25 A away
Retrieve all the sidechains from the input pose. Multi_use is not enabled because we will use the original sidechains both times. The first call to SARS only saves the sidechains, second call retrieves them. Used to switch to full atom poses ????Same a a RemoveConstrintMover????? New filter created to normalize dG and E_total ((8)) New filter created to normalize dG and E_total ((8)) Save # of interface residues that are designable contacts in scorefile ((6)) Save # of interface residues that are designable contacts in scorefile -- after local docking Save # of interface residues that are designable contacts in scorefile -- after local docking Save # of interface residues that are designable contacts in scorefile -- after local docking
New filter created to filter based on back bone BUNs ((11)) New filter created to filter based on back bone BUNs ((11)) New filter created to filter based on side chain BUNs ((12)) New filter created to filter based on side chain BUNs ((12)) New filter created to filter based on back bone + side chain BUNs ((13)) New filter created to filter based on back bone + side chain BUNs ((13)) New filter/score based on solven accessible surface area ((10)) ((9))
Apply backbone coordinate constraints onto receptor CAs with 1 angstrom flat-bottom Calculate binding energies, buried interface surface areas, packing statistics, and other useful interface metrics for the evaluation of protein interfaces. Runs packstat on bound state. Does not run interface_sc on bound state. Does not repack the input before calculating bound state values. Does repack chains after separation, which increases unbound state evaluation. Moves only chain B. Does not report output to a Tracer. Mutates entire chain B residues to LEU for global docking. This "RunSimpleMetrics" mover was added in order to score the pose during docking. Intended for determining docking parameters only, not for complete design runs. ((16))

Only 1 repeat of FastDesign
3 repeats of FastDesign
